meaning: A structured collection of data that can easily be accessed, searched and modified.
A database where all data is stored in a single table, usually in a format such as CSV.
A database where data is split up into multiple tables, using keys to link related data.
A system of organising data using fields and records.
A single element of a table
A category of data, including varchar, int and datetime in SQL.
A unique identifier for each record in a table.
A reference to the primary key of another table in a relational database.
Where the same information is stored in multiple places. Can be avoided using a relational database
Where the same information is stored differently in multiple places; may include typos and spelling mistakes. Can be avoided using a relational database
A variable length string in SQL.
A fixed length string in SQL.
